intro: Chaerophyllum plicatum, commonly known as the clustered cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a short stem with alternating leaves that are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, lace-like appearance. Its flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, bloom in late spring to early summer.
